intro: Betonica officinalis var. hirta, commonly known as hairy betony, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to purple flowers from late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks. Betonica officinalis var. hirta has been historically used in herbal medicine for its purported calming and digestive properties.
